text.text_translated: Scientists are asking more questions about how genes, which are parts of our bodies that carry information about us, influence the brain and language development. For example, did a gene mutation, which is a change in a gene, give us the ability to speak? Researchers have found a gene mutation that happened between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago. This mutation seems to be connected to speaking and how our brains control our mouths and faces. Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not have this mutation. It is still too early to say how much genes influence language, but one day the answers might be found in our DNA.
